newsitem.title: UK: Mental health carers abuse homosexuals - report.
newsitem.headline: Mental health carers abuse homosexuals - report.

text.p: Lesbians, gays and bisexuals say mental health professionals abuse them verbally and physically and are at the very least discriminatory, a British charity said on Wednesday.
The mental health charity Mind said homosexuals and bisexuals were experiencing a "climate of fear" when using mental health services.

"Despite the fact that homosexuality has not been listed as a mental health problem for over 20 years, it is clear that many mental health professionals still consider homosexuality to be a mental illness or a cause of mental distress," Judi Clements, chief executive of Mind, said in a statement.
The charity questioned 55 gay, lesbian and bisexual people and found 73 percent had been discriminated against and some reported physical assault or verbal abuse.
More than half said staff had inappropriately described their sexuality as part of their problems.
